alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:02AM CDT until April 05 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT FOR NORTHERN CHEROKEE COUNTY... At 301 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over West Mineral, or near Columbus, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Broadcast media. Quarter size hail was reported east of Oswego, Kansas. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Cherokee, Weir, Sherman, Scammon, West Mineral, Roseland, Lawton, Carona, Skidmore, Hallowell, Sherwin and Stippville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
